summary:
A highly motivated analytical thinker and conscientious researcher, with experience in research and analysis of cross-border serious and organized crime, human trafficking and migrant smuggling. Having gained experience working both for the European Union and the United Nations, I bring policy-oriented and evidence-based research to every project. My passion for law enforcement cooperation in criminal matters and intelligence analysis has led me on a path to career development in the crime research field. 

I have a proven ability to apply research methods and analytical thinking to various crime areas and I can adapt my knowledge to related technical fields. I am experienced in applying OSINT research tools and techniques to support the production of intelligence notifications and threat assessments. Subject-specific research expertise includes trafficking in persons, smuggling of migrants, the impact of COVID-19 on organized crime, corruption, cybercrime, illicit trafficking of counterfeit products and links between civil unrest, organized crime and terrorism. I have supported the production of global flagship reports, such as the Global Organized Crime Index and the Global Report on Trafficking in Persons. 

I am genuinely curious about connecting the dots and identifying patterns, trends and insights from a variety of subjects. Throughout my academic career, I examined global challenges in the context of geopolitical, historical and social developments, and gained research expertise in regional politics and security dynamics in the MENA region. 

I am multilingual and thrive in a highly international environment. Being one of the twenty students selected to participate in an intensive academic and internship program in Globalization and International Affairs in New York City, I gained first-hand experience in the work of the United Nations at UNHQ. 

Outside the academic and professional fields, I enjoy dedicating time to community projects and volunteer work together with my Rotaract family. I firmly believe in and care about the achievement of SDG 4 quality education and SDG 2 zero hunger. When not reading about psychology and human behaviour, you will find me jogging, painting, or planning my next trip to a new place.

treasury_media.title: The Changing Landscape of Open Source Intelligence.pdf
treasury_media.description: The landscape of open-source intelligence has been evolving at a rapid pace, and it is a matter of time before the entire process of data collection, processing, analysis and dissemination becomes fully automated or at least, largely dependent on new and emerging technologies. As data becomes larger, more complex and more dispersed, new ways and tools for optimizing the use of OSINT could become increasingly in demand, such as quantum computing, machine learning and even the use of the metaverse.

projects.title: Capstone Project: Russian Foreign Policy vis-à-vis the Enlargement of NATO in Georgia
projects.description: The purpose of this research project is to analyze the response of the Russian Federation vis-a-vis the enlargement agenda of NATO in Georgia. First, an overview of the Russo-Georgian conflict is given. Thereafter, the theories of structural realism and cognitive geopolitics are outlined and linked to the research puzzle. The empirical part of this project applies the variables of power distribution and perception of decision makers to explain the foreign policy of Russia towards the enlargement agenda of NATO in the case of Georgia. First of all, the findings of this study show that Russia was compelled to shift the power distribution in the 2008 Russo-Georgian war by creating a frozen conflict. This foreign policy action is explained through the structural realist approach. Secondly, the results show that the response of Russia is influenced by the perception of decision-makers in Russia, who see the expansion of NATO as a security threat. This aspect is explained through the prism of cognitive geopolitics. Finally, the project concludes by incorporating the structural realist approach with the cognitive dimension, proving that both theories are necessary in order to coherently explain the response of Russia vis-a-vis the enlargement agenda of NATO in Georgia.

company.name: Global Initiative against Transnational Organized Crime

profile_positions.company: Global Initiative against Transnational Organized Crime
profile_positions.description:
• Supported research and project-related activities of the academic, drug policy and anti-human trafficking teams.
• Conducted research and drafted sections of a situational analysis on organized crime in the Mekong Sub-region.
• Conducted a literature review on the commercial sexual exploitation of children in West Africa.
• Drafted a research proposal for a study on the potential impact of drug policy reforms on organized crime and illicit economies.
• Identified and synthesized key research findings from studies on organized crime for the Journal of Illicit Economies and Development (JIED).
• Researched and drafted submissions to the UN OHCHR on human trafficking in conflict settings and human trafficking and technology.
• Participated in and contributed to the Tech Against Trafficking (TAT) 2023 Accelerator Program. 
• Supported the organization of a 24-hour conference on global organized crime by supervising a team of 12 volunteers, conducting and leading training sessions, preparing background material, liaising with panellists and hosting the online sessions.
profile_positions.title: Associate

profile_positions.company: Global Initiative against Transnational Organized Crime
profile_positions.description:
• Carried out extensive open-source research for the Global Organized Crime Index 2023.
• Updated country profiles by drafting content and analyzing 26 indicators divided into criminal markets, criminal actors and resilience.
• Evaluated the potential impact of the war in Ukraine on transnational organized crime threats. 
• Collated information on transnational organized crime and emerging crimes on a global level to update the Index database of country profiles and support the ranking of countries.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Contributed to developing effective international responses to transnational organized crime threats by drafting sections of a study on human trafficking in Nigeria.
• Outlined the structure of Nigerian criminal networks involved in human trafficking and identified new modi operandi of organized crime groups.
• Coded information into themes from more than 143 semi-structured interviews on human trafficking in Nigeria.
• Conducted independent research on illicit financial flows (IFFs) from human trafficking by determining the direction and reach of IFFs, identifying payment modalities and analyzing money laundering schemes.
• Translated research findings into political priorities by synthesizing policy-relevant information and drafting input for a briefing of the UN Security Council.
• Drafted evidence-based policy recommendations to strengthen the criminal justice response to human trafficking in Bangladesh.
• Compiled estimates of criminal market shares which received internal recognition.
• Assisted with preparing content for a joint UNODC - UNESCO Futures Literacy Lab by drafting five scenarios on the future of research.
• Assisted with the preparation of training booklets and created presentations for training.
profile_positions.title: Intern - Crime Research Section (Human Trafficking and Migrant Smuggling)

profile_positions.description: • Co-drafted a guide on the security of major sporting events and sports for preventing violent extremism (PVE) and terrorism.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Created more than 30 OSINT research reports to fill information gaps in the production of Europol's strategic analysis publications.
• Evaluated the potential impact of a global economic recession on serious and organized crime by drafting a section of the EU Serious and Organised Crime Threat Assessment (SOCTA) 2021.
• Analyzed the threat of civil unrest, political violence and terrorism, and identified its links to organized crime in the EU Member States.
• Employed horizon scanning and risk assessment to address the future impact of organized crime in the EU.
• Handled scarcity of data under time constraints by providing research assistance to Europol's monitoring of the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the organized crime landscape in the EU.
• Comprehended the role of strategic analysis in the EU Policy Cycle by creating presentations and drafting information materials on policing, intelligence, and EU policymaking.
• Organized the practical side of Europol's virtual Foresight Exercise, from liaising with subject matter experts and law enforcement officials to solving technical issues during the virtual workshop.
profile_positions.title: Open Source Intelligence Intern - Strategic Analysis

profile_positions.description:
• Attended UN Security Council meetings and drafted summary reports to assess the humanitarian situation in Syria and Yemen.
• Carried out in-depth policy research to monitor and evaluate the UN peace and security reform agenda.
• Followed high-level policymaking by attending meetings during the UN General Assembly 2018.
• Monitored topics related to crimes of genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes by analyzing developments in the International Criminal Court situation countries.
• Managed formal email and phone correspondence by liaising with subject-matter experts of the Academic Council of the United Nations System.
• Represented the organization at high-level meetings and UNGA side events.

profile_positions.description:

• Drafted feature stories and analytical reports published in the international news section.
• Conducted interviews and drafted scripts for breaking news under time pressure.
• Worked systematically with content and video production systems.
